message.content:
After reviewing every transaction in the period, we see that none of the “Initial” transactions carried any tax–so the opening (initial) balance for taxes payable is 0.00. Then, by reviewing all sales (because the “tax_amount” is reported on sale transactions) we add up every tax amount from those “Sale” rows. The step‐by‐step scan (shown above) gives a cumulative tax “collected” over the period equal to 341835.08. (Note that no tax “payment” adjustments are recorded here, so the ending tax payable is simply the sum of the tax amounts on Sales.)

Thus the taxes payable item is:
  Taxes Payable Initial Value: 0.00 
  Taxes Payable End Value: 341835.08

The answer in the required JSON format is as follows:

--------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Taxes Payable Initial Value": "0.00", "Taxes Payable End Value": "341835.08"} }
